## Plan to Fix Ruby Element Support for Chrome

I'll rewrite the tokenizer display to use proper HTML ruby elements instead of CSS display properties for better browser compatibility:

### Changes to make:

1. **Update JavaScript rendering** (`/public/tokenizer.js`):
   - Modify the `renderTokenAndText` function to generate proper ruby HTML structure
   - Each token/text pair will use `<ruby>` with `<rb>` for text and `<rt>` for token ID

2. **Update CSS styles** (`/public/tokenizer.css`):
   - Remove the `display: ruby-base` and `display: ruby-text` properties
   - Add proper styling for the native ruby elements
   - Maintain the visual appearance with font sizes and spacing

The new HTML structure will be:
```html
<ruby>
  <rb style="background: #color">text</rb>
  <rt>token_id</rt>
</ruby>
```

This approach uses standard HTML5 ruby elements which have much better browser support, especially in Chrome.
